polished_script:
HOOK: A $2.1 million deal vanished because he ignored advice he'd heard a hundred times. [ON-SCREEN: $2.1 MILLION LOST]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: You've been told to follow up fast, nurture your database, price strategically. You nod, you agree, you keep doing exactly what you've always done. [ON-SCREEN: YOU'VE HEARD IT ALL BEFORE] Jeff Biebuyck has sold hundreds of millions in luxury real estate, been to every mastermind, hired the best coaches. 
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But here's what he told me about the only advice that actually changes your behavior.

INSIGHT: "The best advice I've gotten is from the mistakes I've learned, because otherwise it wouldn't have been good advice to myself." [ON-SCREEN: MISTAKES = BEST ADVICE] Here's what happened: His mentor told him for years to follow up within 24 hours. He nodded every time. Then he waited three days to call back a hot lead. [ON-SCREEN: 3 DAYS TOO LATE] Someone else swooped in. $2.1 million gone. That's when the advice became real â€” not when he heard it, but when it cost him.

REFRAME: If you fumbled a deal this year â€” overpriced and watched it sit, didn't call back fast enough, let a buyer ghost you â€” that's not failure. That's tuition for the only kind of advice that actually rewrites your behavior. [ON-SCREEN: FAILURE = TUITION]

CTA: "What's the one deal you lost this year that still stings?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."

---
